channel.title: I didn't receive any coins in my wallet
channel.description:
Hello,
I downloaded the bitbay qt wallet in the beginning of the year and transferred some BAY to the receiving address that is shown. I was in a hurry, because the exchange, where i bought the coins, said i had to move those, otherwise they would get lost. So i didn't waste time and sent the coins to the qt wallet, while the blockchain was still downloading. After i downloaded it completely, the balance was 0. I read something about private keys, but didn't have to create something like this in the beginning. So i just downloaded the wallet and the blockchain and sent coins to the receiving address. Can you help me finding my coins? Thanks in advance!

item.title: I didn't receive any coins in my wallet
item.dc:creator: @tradersnow
item.description:
@tradersnow wrote:

Right now, LA Token is the only exchange that is offering BAY trading. They had to temporarily pause trading to fix a bug.

Keep an eye out on Telegram and Discord for announcements and updates on the trading, as we hope it will open back up soon.

Read full topic

item.title: I didn't receive any coins in my wallet
item.dc:creator: @scuzzle Robin
item.description:
@scuzzle wrote:

Ah, I undersant. Do you know an exchange, where I can trade BAY?

Read full topic
item.source: I didn't receive any coins in my wallet

item.title: I didn't receive any coins in my wallet
item.dc:creator: @tradersnow
item.description:
@tradersnow wrote:

Glad they are now showing up!
‘Spendable’ and ‘Reserve’ are the two different tradable assets that make up BitBays blockchain.

Here is some more information:

Why are my wallet balances always changing? Dynamic Peg - FAQ
Have no fear, this is exactly what the Dynamic Peg is design to do. The core function of this system is to split BitBay’s total supply into two (2) different tradeable assets: Spendable (BAY) and Reserve (BAYR). The ratio between these two assets is constantly in flux, due to voting of stakers on the BitBay blockchain. When the voting consensus is “deflate”, the total supply of Liquid BAY decreases and the total supply of Reserve BAYR increases. When the voting consensus “inflate” the suppl…

And no need for payment, the pleasure is all mine.

Read full topic
item.source: I didn't receive any coins in my wallet

item.title: I didn't receive any coins in my wallet
item.dc:creator: @scuzzle Robin
item.description:
@scuzzle wrote:

I dont know, where my mistake was in the past, but now i can see my coins. Thanks a lot sir! Now i got the next question. What does “Spendable” and “Reserve” mean? Nearly all of my coins are on Reserve. Can i still send those? If no, why and when will I be able?

Can you give me your BAY address, so that I can send you some coins for your invested time? Thank you very much!

Read full topic
item.source: I didn't receive any coins in my wallet

item.title: I didn't receive any coins in my wallet
item.dc:creator: @tradersnow
item.description:
@tradersnow wrote:

Okay, so your coins are safe at that address, as long as you have the wallet.dat file associated with them.

Are these the instructions you followed when trying to update?

How to update the Client and/or QT wallet to the latest version Get Started Guides
How to update the Client and/or QT wallet to the latest version ***Note: All download links on the BitBay site point to the latest version How to update the BitBay QT Wallet: Find the download link for your platform here: https://bitbay.market/downloads Backup your wallet before doing anything! Once the update has been downloaded and installed, simply replace the previous QT wallet file with the new one. That’s it! You are now running the latest version, which has Dynamic Peg voting capab…

Read full topic
item.source: I didn't receive any coins in my wallet

item.title: I didn't receive any coins in my wallet
item.dc:creator: @scuzzle Robin
item.description:
@scuzzle wrote:

Thank you for your help. The coins are showing there.
I use QT version 5.11.1.
Strangely it shows a different receiving address now
I tried to update the wallet like in the forum described, but it didnt work. I had a new wallet, new receiving address, but no coins.
I never did have private keys and that makes me think, that my coins could be gone.

Read full topic
item.source: I didn't receive any coins in my wallet

item.title: I didn't receive any coins in my wallet
item.dc:creator: @tradersnow
item.description:
@tradersnow wrote:

What version of the QT wallet are you running?

You can check the receiving address here on chainz:
https://chainz.cryptoid.info/bay/

If the coins show up here, then you still have them and it’s simply an issue of updating your wallet.

If you need any help with updating to the latest version, let us know.

Read full topic
